member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.ThreeSeriesTcpIpEthernetIntersystemCommunications
member.summary: The Three Series Ethernet ISC symbol allows Ethernet communication between two 3 series control systems that each have an Three Series Ethernet ISC symbol defined.
member.remarks: This device uses the TCP protocol and supports automatic staggering to reduce load.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.ThreeSeriesTcpIpEthernetIntersystemCommunications.#ctor(System.UInt32,System.String,Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronControlSystem)
member.summary: Constructor to generate a new Dynamic Ethernet Intersystem Communication device.
member.param: Ethernet IPID of the device.
IP Address of the EISC to connect to.
Control system this ethernet interface is a part of.
member.exception: When "CrestronEnvironment.DevicePlatform" is set to "eDevicePlatform.Server", this device is not supported. Use either , , or .

member.summary: Method to enable an Ethernet port with a rising edge.

member.summary: Number of this port on the device.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.Port.EthernetState
member.summary: Current state of the port when last event received from the device.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.Port.InputForEnable
member.summary: Input status for enabling an Ethernet port. A rising edge to enable to port.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.Port.EnableFeedback
member.summary: Reports if a port is enabled. An Ethernet port is enabled when it is true and the port is disabled when it is false.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.Port.InputForDisable
member.summary: Input status for disabling an Ethernet Port. A rising edge to disable the port.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.Port.LinkStatusFeedback
member.summary: Reports a port link status. An Ethernet port link is on when it is true and the link is off when it is false.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.Port.AutoNegotiationFeedback
member.summary: Reports a port auto negotiation setting. An Ethernet port auto negotiation is on when it is true and the auto negotiation is off when it is false.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.Port.FullDuplexSettingFeedback
member.summary: Reports a port full duplex settings. An Ethernet port is full duplex when it is true and the port is half duplex when it is false.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.Port.LinkSpeedFeedback
member.summary: Reports an Ethernet port's link speed. Link Speed = 10,100,or 1000 (Mbps)

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.VirtualControlEISCClient
member.summary: Class for the VirtualControlEISCClient - This will be a CIP client to an Virtual Control server. When running on a dedicated control system, the admin needs to set the global VirtualControlServer setting or else the registration will fail. When running on a Virtual Control server, this can be used to connect to a running at the specified IP Id in a program at the specified RoomID. The advantage of using this device over an is that, the device association is done based on the programInstanceId automatically.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.VirtualControlEISCClient.#ctor(System.UInt32,System.String,Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronControlSystem)
member.summary: Constructor to generate a new Virtual Control Ethernet Intersystem Communication device.
member.param: Ethernet IPID of the running on the Virtual Control device.
ID of the room running the at the specified IP Id on the Virtual Control server.
Control system this ethernet interface is a part of.

member.summary: Method to initialize a POE port.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.PoePort.PoeState
member.summary: Current state of the port when last event received from the device.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.PoePort.InputForPoeEnable
member.summary: Input status to enable port POE when it is true/1 (Rising edge).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.PoePort.PoeEnableFeedback
member.summary: Reports if a PoE port is enabled. Port POE enabled when it is true and disable when it is false.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.PoePort.InputForPoeDisable
member.summary: Input status to disable Port POE when it is true/1 (Rising edge).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.PoePort.InputForPoeEnableOnBoot
member.summary: Input status to enable port POE on boot up when it is true/1 (Rising edge).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.PoePort.PoeEnableOnBootFeedback
member.summary: Reports if a port's POE is enabled on boot up. Port POE is enabled on boot up when it is true and is disabled on boot up when it is false.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.PoePort.InputForPoeDisableOnBoot
member.summary: Input status to disable Port POE on boot up. A rising edge will disable the POE on boot up.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.PoePort.PoeDeviceAttachedFeedback
member.summary: Reports if a PoE device is attached on a port. A POE device is attached on the port when it is true and no POE device is attached when it is false.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.PoePort.PoePowerUsedFeedback
member.summary: Power used in mW for the device attached to this port.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.PoePort.PoePowerAllocatedFeedback
member.summary: Power allocated in mW for the device attached to this port.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.PoePort.PoePowerClass
member.summary: Power class required by the device attached to this port.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.EthernetIntersystemCommunications
member.summary: The Ethernet ISC symbol allows Ethernet communication between control systems (or other applications) that each have an Ethernet ISC symbol defined.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.EthernetCommunication.EthernetIntersystemCommunications.#ctor(System.UInt32,System.String,Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronControlSystem)
member.summary: Constructor to generate a new Ethernet Intersystem Communication device.
member.param: Ethernet IPID of the device.
IP Address of the EISC to connect to. Specifying an IP Address of 127.0.0.2 allows for two programs on the same controller to talk to each other.
Control system this ethernet interface is a part of.
member.exception: When "CrestronEnvironment.DevicePlatform" is set to "eDevicePlatform.Server", this device is not supported. Use either , , or .
